alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 12 at 3:05AM MDT until October 12 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM FOR THE NORTHEAST PLAINS, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS, CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, EAST CENTRAL PLAINS, AND MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .A Pacific storm system will bring strong west to northwest winds and very low humidity to northern and central New Mexico today. Rapid fire spread is possible in receptive fuel beds. Winds are expected to taper off quickly after sunset. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (104), Northeast Highlands (123), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (124), Central Highlands (125), East Central Plains (126), and Middle Rio Grande Valley (106) from 11 AM through 7 PM MDT today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts of 45 to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
